Context:
The Indigenous Initiatives team at George Brown College promotes knowledge sharing and supports students in achieving their academic, work, and life goals. They offer various services and events to promote understanding and appreciation of Indigenous culture. The team can be contacted via email at indigenous.services@georgebrown.ca or by phone at 416-415-5000 ext. 3969.

The team has three locations: St. James (Sahkitcheway) at 200 King St. E, Room 562D in Toronto ON M5A 3W8, Canada; Casa Loma (Wi Chi Hito Win) at 160 Kendal Ave., Room 335D in Toronto ON M5R 1M3, Canada; and Waterfront (Jiigibiik nibwaakaawin teg) at 51 Dockside Dr., Room 227 in Toronto ON M5A 1B6, Canada.

Some services are dedicated to students who are members of a First Nations, MÃ©tis, or Inuit community (status or non-status), but most events and cultural teachings are available to all students. To stay informed about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more, sign up on their website.

The contact number for general inquiries is 416-415-2000, with TTY at 1-877-515-5559, and the email address is ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college's social media hub can also be visited for more information.

The information contained in this website is subject to change without notice. It should not be viewed as a representation, offer, or warranty, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
